channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: MossFormer: Pushing the Performance Limit of Monaural Speech Separation using Gated Single-Head Transformer with Convolution-Augmented Joint Self-Attentions
item.description: To effectively solve the indirect elemental interactions across chunks in the dual-path architecture, MossFormer employs a joint local and global self-attention architecture that simultaneously performs a full-computation self-attention on local chunks and a linearised low-cost self-attention over the full sequence.

item.title: Gaze-LLE: Gaze Target Estimation via Large-Scale Learned Encoders
item.description: We address the problem of gaze target estimation, which aims to predict where a person is looking in a scene.

item.title: Segment Any Text: A Universal Approach for Robust, Efficient and Adaptable Sentence Segmentation
item.description: We introduce a new model - Segment any Text (SaT) - to solve this problem.

item.title: StableAnimator: High-Quality Identity-Preserving Human Image Animation
item.description: During inference, we propose a novel Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman (HJB) equation-based optimization to further enhance the face quality.

item.title: SynCamMaster: Synchronizing Multi-Camera Video Generation from Diverse Viewpoints
item.description: Recent advancements in video diffusion models have shown exceptional abilities in simulating real-world dynamics and maintaining 3D consistency.

item.title: Learning Flow Fields in Attention for Controllable Person Image Generation
item.description: Additionally, we show that our loss is model-agnostic and can be used to improve the performance of other diffusion models.

item.title: Neural Localizer Fields for Continuous 3D Human Pose and Shape Estimation
item.description: With the explosive growth of available training data, single-image 3D human modeling is ahead of a transition to a data-centric paradigm.

item.title: Video Seal: Open and Efficient Video Watermarking
item.description: To reduce these gaps, this paper introduces Video Seal, a comprehensive framework for neural video watermarking and a competitive open-sourced model.

item.title: HunyuanVideo: A Systematic Framework For Large Video Generative Models
item.description: In this report, we introduce HunyuanVideo, an innovative open-source video foundation model that demonstrates performance in video generation comparable to, or even surpassing, that of leading closed-source models.

item.title: LLMs-as-Judges: A Comprehensive Survey on LLM-based Evaluation Methods
item.description: Finally, we provide a detailed analysis of the limitations of LLM judges and discuss potential future directions.

item.title: HelloMeme: Integrating Spatial Knitting Attentions to Embed High-Level and Fidelity-Rich Conditions in Diffusion Models
item.description: We propose an effective method for inserting adapters into text-to-image foundation models, which enables the execution of complex downstream tasks while preserving the generalization ability of the base model.

item.title: OmniDocBench: Benchmarking Diverse PDF Document Parsing with Comprehensive Annotations
item.description: Document content extraction is crucial in computer vision, especially for meeting the high-quality data needs of large language models (LLMs) and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) technologies.

item.title: FireFlow: Fast Inversion of Rectified Flow for Image Semantic Editing
item.description: Though Rectified Flows (ReFlows) with distillation offers a promising way for fast sampling, its fast inversion transforms images back to structured noise for recovery and following editing remains unsolved.

item.title: One Diffusion to Generate Them All
item.description: Experimental results demonstrate competitive performance across tasks in both generation and prediction such as text-to-image, multiview generation, ID preservation, depth estimation and camera pose estimation despite relatively small training dataset.

item.title: Docling Technical Report
item.description: This technical report introduces Docling, an easy to use, self-contained, MIT-licensed open-source package for PDF document conversion.

item.title: Papers-in-100-Lines-of-Code
item.description: Implementation of papers in 100 lines of code.

item.title: Maya: An Instruction Finetuned Multilingual Multimodal Model
item.description: The rapid development of large Vision-Language Models (VLMs) has led to impressive results on academic benchmarks, primarily in widely spoken languages.

item.title: Towards Controllable Speech Synthesis in the Era of Large Language Models: A Survey
item.description: In this paper, we conduct a comprehensive survey of controllable TTS, covering approaches ranging from basic control techniques to methods utilizing natural language prompts, aiming to provide a clear understanding of the current state of research.

item.title: Infinity: Scaling Bitwise AutoRegressive Modeling for High-Resolution Image Synthesis
item.description: We present Infinity, a Bitwise Visual AutoRegressive Modeling capable of generating high-resolution, photorealistic images following language instruction.

item.title: An Evolved Universal Transformer Memory
item.description: Prior methods propose to offset the escalating costs of modern foundation models by dropping specific parts of their contexts with hand-designed rules, while attempting to preserve their original performance.
